result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D. Maples was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid while on extended supervision in Ct.8.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Ct.7 - Pay fine of $1,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges (to be paid while on extended supervision in Ct.8)
*  Ct.8 - Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with known felons or Dennis Maples, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain stable residence.  Obtain/maintain verifiable employment.
*  Pay prosecution costs of $153.00.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas D. Maples, appeared with Attorney David P. Geraghty.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 7 -   Court imposes a fine of $1000 plus costs and shall be paid during extended supervision in Count 8 
Count 8 - DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP forthwith; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 42 months Extended Supervision.  Credit for 1 day.  DE is taken into custody.  Parties stipulate to prosecution costs in the amount of $153.00. DNA surcharge and DNA costs also ordered.  No contact with Dennis M. or any known felons.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  
Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Sentencing rescheduled to 6/3/15 at 10:30 AM per confirmation with Atty Geraghty and Atty Geraghty to provide notice to defendant.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas D. Maples, appeared with Attorney David P. Geraghty.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Counts 7 and 8 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 through 6 and 9 are Dismissed and Read IN.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 4/24/15 at 11:30 AM.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Nicholas D. Maples, appeared with Attorney David P. Geraghty.  Clerk: PT
Arguments heard on DE's motion to sever counts and DE's motion to suppress.  Upon hearing oral arguments the motion to sever counts and motion to suppress are denied by the court.   Case is still unresolved and remains set for trial as previously scheduled.
